page.title: 12 Linlithgow Canal
page.content: The building of the{Union Canal, which runs through Linlithgow,began in 1818 and was completed in 1822.It runs from Edinburgh to Glasgow and was built for passangers and barges carrying coal and manure. Today interest in the canal has grown And the{Linlithgow Union Canal {Society}run trips on a boat called the "Victoria".There is also a Museum run by the society showing the history of the canal. There is a{Canoe Club}which meets on a Thursday at the canal and is open to people of all ages. In September there is a boat race which is organised by the L.U.C.S. The race starts in Glasgow and ends in Edinburgh,taking two days to complete. The canal is used by many people for walking,running and cycling and is an interesting place to visit.
